author: Quince Cat
comment: Speaking of the really tall gray bear-  WARNING: SPOILERS  The tall gray bear is tall, we all of course understand- he's a bear- but wait-  The character that devours Tem (TeMmIe--) is obviously a carnivore, and the animators made it seem like Legoshi was doing things there with the sharp teeth and dark mood sort of- but take a close look at the ears on that carnivore. Not at all pointy like Legoshi's. In fact, in the episode with the good old Panda guy, he shows Legoshi and the audience a panda and a grizzly comparison book. Similar-  Also, why would the tall gray bear's face not get shown? You could say he's tall, but still. And, at the end of Season 1, the character's perspective that we're looking at is clearly taller that Legoshi, but isn't Legoshi the tallest in the club? Tem hints (before he gets devoured) that his own classmate devoured him. Maybe in the same club then? Legoshi didn't do it, and we as the audience know that. Anyways, if the character that we're looking at the perspective of maybe has some sort of pill, AND is slightly taller than Legoshi- Maybe, just maybe- It's a bear. Bears are taller than wolves, and Legoshi probably know the bear guy from the club, so- WE HAVE OURSELVES A SUSPECT FOR BEING A MURDERER- devourer.. thing..

author: Shadowlover187 #H9mestuckF9rever
comment: I swear people are so close minded sometimes. Just because it has anthropomorphic animals, doesn't make it a furry anime or whatever. It's a form of art, an expression of many things. They just choose to use animals instead of people. Which I find much more appealing. Now while I am not a furry myself, and I don't have anything against them except for the ones that are indeed into beastiality, I do enjoy drawing and writing stories about anthros. They are very interesting and there is so much you can do with animal characters! That being said, my arsenal of characters has more than just anthros, obviously lol. And for people who think THIS anime is beastiality, then they clearly don't know what beastiality actually is. Anthropomorphic characters are fictional animal characters that are basically just humans in animal skin or fur in many cases. Meanwhile, actual animals, while having the ability to convey emotions at times, they are not of the same level of intelligence as humans are. That's the main thing that separates an animal from a fictional anthropomorphic animal among many many other things. All that being said, if you choose to identify as a furry or identify your characters as furry characters then that is perfectly fine. However, harassing people about it is not okay.

author: Urzica
comment: In a world populated by anthropomorphic animals, herbivores and carnivores coexist. For the adolescences of Cherryton Academy, school life is filled with hope, romance, distrust, and uneasiness.  The main character is Legoshi the wolf, a member of the drama club. Despite his menacing appearance, he has a very gentle heart. Throughout most of his life, he has always been an object to be feared and hated by other animals, and he has become quite accustomed to that lifestyle. But following the murder of a classmate, he finds himself becoming more involved with his other peers, who have their own share of insecurities, and finds his life in school changing slowly.
